overview:
Paul is the founder & CEO of Cognection, a NYC-based startup that has commercialized academic research in behavioral economics to improve online retail experiences. In live beta tests with top retailers, Cognection’s preference discovery and recommendation software has increased online purchase conversions by over 12%.

Paul studied cognitive science with a focus in consumer behavior at Yale University. At Yale, Paul served as the Economics Project Head at the Yale Comparative Cognition Laboratory, where he investigated the origins of human irrationality with capuchin monkeys. He also completed coursework and conducted research in experimental economics at King’s College at the University of Cambridge. Paul previously served as a research assistant at the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania in the organizational behavior department.

In 2003, Paul founded Trinston Diversified, LLC., a web services firm with over fifty clients and thirteen employees. His work has been featured in major publications, including The Times of London and Delovoy Peterburg of St. Petersburg, and at several European conferences, including events at the London Stock Exchange.

Paul’s other interests (in no order) include grilled cheese, entrepreneurship, comedy, music cognition, economics, Roquefort cheese, psychology, UI/UX, philosophy, international relations, anti-genocide activism, monkeys, parapraxes, neuroscience, and great company.
